titles.title: To amend section 3056 of title 18, United States Code, to limit secret service protection of former Presidents when they are traveling to engage in income-producing activities.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 1/4/1995--Introduced. Amends the Federal criminal code to prohibit secret service protection, other than on a reimbursable basis, for any former President or family member who is away from his or her domicile and who directly or indirectly obtains income from activities while away.
